# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is a function that wraps text to a specified text width:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    curr_len = 0
    result = IOBuffer()
    for word in words
        word_len = length(word)
        if curr_len + word_len > text_width
            println(result)
            curr_len = 0
        end
        print(result, word, " ")
        curr_len += word_len + 1
    end
    return String(take!(result))  
end

# Example
text = "This is a test string that will wrap across multiple lines"

print(wrap_string(text)) 
```

This iterates through the words, keeping track of the current line length. When adding the next word would exceed the text width, it prints a new line and resets the current line length counter. It builds the result string in an IOBuffer before converting back to a String at the end.

The example wraps the text to lines less than 10 characters.
